contextId.information: a group of soldiers so large that it was difficult to count them (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: troops as numerous as the sand on the seashore

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration to emphasize how much honey there was in the forest. AT: "there was a lot of honey everywhere" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

This exaggeration shows how the people of Israel would protect Jonathan and keep him safe. This litotes can be stated in a positive form. AT: "we will protect him from any harm" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: not one hair of his head will fall to the ground

contextId.information: This is hyperbole to emphasize the great number of women who came. AT: "from many of the cities throughout Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: from all the cities of Israel

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration. AT: "Many people who were distressed ... many people who were unhappy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: Everyone who was in distress ... everyone who was discontented

contextId.information: This is likely a generalization. A large number of the people of Israel were probably there, but some were probably unable to attend. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: All Israel gathered together and mourned for him
